metadata.title: CVE-2023-1829 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux Kernel traffic control indexfilter (tcindex) can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation.The tcindex_delete function which does not properly deactivate filters incase of a perfect hashes while deleting the underlying structure which canlater lead to double freeing the structure. A local attacker user can usethis vulnerability to elevate its privileges to root. We recommendupgrading past commit 8c710f75256bb3cf05ac7b1672c82b92c43f3d28.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required
